sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> hits the <radical>greenhouse</radical>, destroying the last remaining plant life in the area. The tsunami recedes, and there is nothing but sand, and the lands become a <kanji>desert</kanji>.
meaningInfo: The greenhouse was your only hope in turning the desert into a green forest. Now it's all washed away by salt water, meaning nothing will grow anyways. Feel disappointed about this.
readingMnemonic: See the sun come up over the <kanji>desert</kanji>, then go <reading>back</reading> (<ja>ばく</ja>) down. Up, back down, back up, back down. You stand here for days watching because you're so depressed. Stop being so <kanji>vague</kanji> in your approach, sun! You’re weirding everyone out!
readingInfo: Up, back down, back up, back down. Move your head up and down to keep up with the sun’s movements. Will it ever rise like normal?
